attributes.action: Satisfy the law abiding British public that terrorism is to be dealt with as treason and that perpetrators suffer the death penalty.
attributes.additional_details: We as law abiding members of the Great British public demand that the government reconsider their position with regard to the death penalty being applied to tried and convicted perpetrators of terrorism, whether by incitement or actual physical involvement. We are saddened and frustrated by the hidden agenda of the Human Rights Act and, if in order to bring an end to past and current atrocities we have to withdraw from our current stance and postion in Europe, so be it. We believe our national security has been compromised for too long and we must regain our identity and pride.
